events.name: Getting started with Puppet - event at AWS, register via Eventbrite
events.description: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/getting-started-with-puppet-singapore-tickets-27138534086 Come and join us for a half day event where attendees of all levels will learn to understand the fundamentals of Puppet as a configuration management automation system. Principal Solutions and Services Engineer - Brett Gray will lead the session that will teach hands on skills of how to use Puppet following best practice.  Brunch refreshments will also be served for all attendees and attendees will recieve an AWS credit to help them get started. Course Outline: 1. Basic Puppet Concepts 2. The Puppet Enterprise Ecosystem Facter Puppet master Puppet agent PE Console PuppetDB Hiera Puppet Forge Modules and Classes 3. Course Conclusion & Getting Started with Puppet on AWS. We look forward to seeing you there!
events.location: Amazon Web Services Singapore, #10-01, 23 Church Street, Singapore 049481

events.name: GIA Value Chain Case Challenge for Students
events.description:
***Open for Students Only Value Chain Case Challenge 2016Business environments are constantly evolving, think you have the next big idea to revolutionize an industry? Take part in the Value Chain Case Challenge 2016 and put your smarts to the test!We want you to challenge the insurance value chain and identity new ways to transform the industry. Parts of the insurance value chain to consider: Distribution, Claims, User Experiences, Products, Data Analytics, Operations and more. The top 3 teams stand to take home cash prizes worth up to S$10,000 and a chance to put their ideas through an accelerator programme plus additional development funding!  GRAND PRIZE:S$6,000 cash + chance to join IBM Global Entrepreneur Programme 2ND PRIZE:S$3,000 cash + chance to join IBM Global Entrepreneur Programme 3RD PRIZE:S$1,000 cash + chance to join IBM Global Entrepreneur Programme All winning proposals also stand to receive up to S$10,000 worth of development funding if accepted for further commercial development!  COMPETITION INFORMATION:• To register, form a team of 4 and click on the link below to register• Each team must comprise members from at least 2 different majors or universities• All interested teams must answer a screening question in the registration form. Only 24 teams will be selected and shortlisted teams will be notified via email.• Registration closes 31 August 2016 or when full capacity is reached, whichever first.  Click on the link below to visit the Value Chain Case Challenge 2016 Official Facebook Page: https://goo.gl/tBwgls  


Please go to https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSejnG0AUatwfbwO1C8T8FB8duQMZBuqAL_R-DcC49yQ3fKrEg/viewform?c=0&w=1 to register for this event!
events.location: Singapore Management University - Ngee Ann Kongsi Auditorium, Level 2, SMU School of Accountancy , 60 Stamford Road Singapore, 178900

events.name: Friday Hacks #116: Internships 101
events.description:
*New venue! We're going to be trying out holding events at The Hangar by NUS Enterprise for this week.*

Learn why you should do internships, how to choose, and of course, how to get them!

Ask questions of other students who have interned locally and overseas at various companies including: Google, Palantir, Microsoft, Stripe, Twitter, Uber, Apple, Viki, GrabTaxi, Facebook, and more!

To the freshmen, it's never too early to start!

You've probably read about tech internships and all their various perks. Heck, you've probaby even seen a movie about it. Now's the time to live it. This talk will address all the questions you've ever had about internships and help you on your way to getting one.

Pizza is served before the talks.

- Speaker Profiles

Vishnu is a Year 4 Computer Science student who previously did internships at Apple, Uber & Twitter.

Zhi An is a Year 4 Computer Science student who previously did internships at Google, Stripe & Uber.
events.location: The Hangar by NUS Enterprise, , Singapore 119613

events.name: Day 1 - IRAS Hackathon 2016
events.description: This is day 1 of a 3-day event hosted by UP Singapore and is being announced on behalf of our community member. Title: IRAS Hackathon 2016 Speakers: Various SMEs, Tech Mentors, Microsoft MVPs, see more at: http://www.upsingapore.com/events/iras-hackathon/#experts Abstract: UP Singapore is proud to announce the first ever IRAS Hackathon! In line with a nation-wide strategy to provide public services with a citizen-centric approach, IRAS would like to explore how to provide best-in-class tax experiences to Singapore’s taxpayers, using intuitive digital services. Learn more about the theme and opportunity areas of this hackathon at our Theme page here: http://bit.ly/iras-theme At the IRAS hackathon, you will have the chance to create and pitch your idea to a senior and distinguished panel of judges. Also, the winning team in both the Startup and Open Categories, will take home a cash prize of $3,000! Sign up now! http://bit.ly/2aXJMHg Learn more about the IRAS Hackathon 2016 here: http://bit.ly/iras-hackathon-2016 We are promoting this event because it aligns with our group interests. For deeper engagement with Apache Apex - follow ApacheApex, presentations, recordings, download (community, sandbox), Apache Apex releases, docs
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium, One Marina Boulevard, Level 21, 018989, Singapore
events.group_name: Apache Apex Next Gen Native Hadoop Big Data, Singapore

events.name: Let's meet to share about improvised lab equipment and home experiments
events.description: This commences a series of regular meet-ups, tentatively scheduled for the first Friday evening of the month. Topics and Venue open for suggestion. More info at: www.OpenBio.asia In this MeetUp (2 Sept), we will be sharing on rapid bacterial DNA detection, 3D VR visualisation of human anatomy and low cost smartphone dermatoscope and otoscope.
events.location: Singapore University of Technology and Design, Cohort Classroom 11, 2.405 (Building 2, Level 4), 8 Somapah Road
